1921BCED9FC64380B0B47896F09A745D.description: identify a strategy they found helpful when presenting texts

6D22B4FC172D4174B6EF5CC1502D28AF.description: present the texts they have created using appropriate strategies, including by reading aloud with expression

946531A5848449949716429B37E4C9D3.description: produce final texts, using simple techniques, to achieve the intended effect

CE859D616AB44B00A02455D0B86A05B1.description: Publishing, Presenting, and Reflecting: select suitable and effective media, techniques, and tools to publish and present final texts, and critically analyze how well the texts address various topics

C72D01E18DEC485BA0AD0C518E8E319C.description: make simple edits to draft texts, such as changes to capitalization, punctuation, and spelling

BF1F713F01094D5B9F4B1EE5A9B28933.description: identify the point of view, including first person, used in their texts

B9318A2A75DB42959CA57171555B92A3.description: demonstrate a personal voice in their texts, with a focus on using words that express their thoughts, feelings, and opinions about the topic

ED860D479CDD44309ACAD0A1A1AA7870.description: print letters and words with appropriate formation patterns, size, placement, and spacing

725D78805EDE454EB1B2222D56DAD04E.description: draft short, simple texts of various forms and genres, including personal narratives, persuasive texts, and procedural texts, using a variety of media, tools, and strategies

509F9C04621242B58019D69E6F0E8D2F.description: Creating Texts: apply knowledge and understanding of various text forms and genres to create, revise, edit, and proofread their own texts, using a variety of media, tools, and/or strategies, and reflect critically on created texts

1CA6E837C9834675BB90BB9A79721E80.description: identify the strategies that helped them to develop ideas for texts

A4039090DF9B4C1B81370AEBDBCBF334.description: sort and sequence ideas and information, taking into account the text form and genre to be used

B3662F32AA034BE5A4BF5A558EC97CDA.description: gather information and content relevant to a topic, using a single source

EB137C2FC4D7431A9611720FFAE13694.description: generate ideas about given and chosen topics, using simple strategies and drawing on various resources, including their own lived experiences, and learning from other subject areas

E3BB627C8E5241B18776CC2836A2DACB.description: identify the topic, purpose, and audience for various simple texts they plan to create

9521324DDCD44E378080A9B63B925EA9.description: Developing Ideas and Organizing Content: plan, develop ideas, gather information, and organize content for creating texts of various forms, including digital and media texts, on a variety of topics

C1A4FB0B780C465A870478E2998E2B4E.description: Composition: Expressing Ideas and Creating Texts

23F85291B9A645DEAEB923339CE53635.description: identify thinking skills that helped them understand simple texts

9B053526A1DC4A239B80BBBCC8D88566.description: identify some ways in which texts created by First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals, communities, groups, or nations communicate about historical periods, cultural experiences, and events, and how they relate to current lived experiences

9EA6F2A2E5C641F9B56BCC814F5D68B5.description: express personal thoughts and feelings about ideas presented in texts, such as ideas about diversity, inclusion, and accessibility

03D7C11E06ED4F49AB61731C2E282A72.description: identify explicit and implicit perspectives communicated in a text, and describe how these perspectives could influence an audience

834D969FB1E04F58920F86BA94843D3B.description: identify some cultural elements represented in various texts, including symbols and values, and explain how these elements contribute to the meaning

3DF9B651949D42219A01FA0CD79E515F.description: analyze simple texts, including literary and informational texts, by identifying and sequencing important information and events

3AD918A0027D4206B4BA6C78B7C70227.description: make simple inferences, using stated and implied information and ideas, to understand simple texts

DE4B23C481C74D7E93BE81EE3087A9C4.description: identify simple literary devices, including rhyme, alliteration, and onomatopoeia, and describe how they help communicate meaning

39080A725520428F955DD9ABE080C339.description: Critical Thinking in Literacy: apply critical thinking skills to deepen understanding of texts, and analyze how various perspectives and topics are communicated and addressed in a variety of texts, including digital, media, and cultural texts

D42CD8E1005F476F99632579126354D0.description: identify strategies, such as activating prior knowledge and visualizing, that have helped them comprehend texts

234BCC92FA3A4B5F81B8899DD22B32F8.description: identify important information in a simple text, including the main idea

17E0E903BD0041B7878C6B96F0909642.description: identify connections between ideas expressed in simple texts and their knowledges and lived experiences, the ideas in other familiar texts, and the world around them

4DAEEF09B68B4649A472D5D6DC9441F6.description: use strategies such as rereading, visualizing, and asking questions, to monitor their understanding of simple texts

38A5BC3242C24D44A3ABCDFC6B6846C7.description: make predictions using background knowledge, text features, and evidence from the text

368238F22CE8467287BAE1B104C20654.description: identify purposes for engaging with texts, including enjoyment or finding information

486207A5FD694441BFABB238B0FAABB7.description: activate prior knowledge, including knowledge gained from personal and text experiences, that they can use to understand the topics of new texts

996879E7AF154CC9851FEE378EBF733E.description: Comprehension Strategies: apply comprehension strategies before, during, and after reading, listening to, and viewing a variety of texts, including digital and media texts, by creators with diverse identities, perspectives, and experience, in order to understand and clarify the meaning of texts

79F22873A9D2424C8971465A8A8F366C.description: read, listen to, and view various forms of texts by diverse First Nations, Métis, and Inuit creators to demonstrate understanding of various aspects of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit histories, cultures, relationships, communities, groups, nations, and lived experiences

71D585D4A3EE43BEB934F1F1A153C212.description: identify the narrator’s point of view in a variety of texts, and suggest an alternative point of view to tell the story

7CEB20BF7964460CACDB6E62C6582333.description: identify some simple elements of style in texts, including voice, word choice, word patterns, and sentence structure, and describe how they help communicate meaning

CA66D7AAF9B34AC49BDBEF3796FBC045.description: demonstrate an understanding of the relationship between simple illustrations, images, and graphics and the text

D34209E70CC4413C9A793363CE4CB8F1.description: identify some text patterns, such as sequencing and chronological order, and text features, including illustrations, symbols, and titles, associated with various text forms, and explain how they help readers, listeners, and viewers understand the meaning

883DFB7194BA475EA7C1F879F7CBCCD1.description: identify simple literary and informational text forms and their associated genres

4E66DEB17AEF4B0DA47A74A2A357D6A3.description: read and comprehend short, simple texts, using knowledge of words, grammar, cohesive ties, sentence structures, and background knowledge

9A95E4A43B364BD397E0D6436B2D6B2F.description: Knowledge about Texts: apply foundational knowledge and skills to understand a variety of texts, including digital and media texts, by creators with diverse identities, perspectives, and experience, and demonstrate an understanding of the patterns, features, and elements of style associated with various text forms and genres

D3A068C2547244DBB980BFB6F3B35A2D.description: Comprehension: Understanding and Responding to Texts

14B0C02A547148BBA45FD48E0DA96F7F.description: use their understanding of the meaning and function of capitalization and punctuation to communicate meaning clearly, including the use of a capital letter at the beginning of a sentence and the appropriate punctuation mark at the end

88939D812F0C45229065CBAA0C4003F5.description: demonstrate an understanding of the functions of parts of speech in sentences, including common singular and plural nouns, using the pronoun “I”, the past, present, and future verb tenses, common adjectives and adverbs, and common conjunctions, and use this knowledge to support comprehension and communicate meaning clearly

8F42738BEDED4420902E304CCC8D857B.description: identify and construct simple and compound sentences, including declarative, imperative, interrogative, and exclamatory sentences

1F59A51ABC3D4924B3D02FC062252D0B.description: Language Conventions for Reading and Writing: demonstrate an understanding of sentence structure, grammar, cohesive ties, and capitalization and punctuation, and apply this knowledge when reading and writing sentences, paragraphs, and a variety of texts

349193784AD94371802B8F919DF19C6E.description: read simple words, short sentences, and paragraphs in a variety of texts fluently, with accuracy and appropriate pacing to support comprehension, and read aloud with expression

EE9BB55502AE44F7A3B9D10F33819A69.description: demonstrate an understanding of commonly used words, acquire and use explicitly taught vocabulary in various contexts, including other subject areas, and use their developing morphological knowledge to analyze and understand new words in context

ACEFB7599B364AADB0288777B2F95119.description: use developing knowledge of the meanings of words and common morphemes (i.e., bases, prefixes, and suffixes) to read and spell words

C9F24BB103054294A0394E6CD881F17A.description: use developing orthographic knowledge, including position-based tendencies, to make a spelling choice or accurately pronounce a word when reading

B3051640317C4623B86BF127B919986E.description: use phonics knowledge and phonemic blending to read words, and phonemic segmentation to spell phonetically regular words, in isolation and various text contexts

AF88D349104A41B7AC5550D99A26DCA6.description: dentify, read, and spell most common grapheme-phoneme correspondences of consonants and vowels, with automaticity

3E9B0235B23F4CBBA1A0C96152A5EA6A.description: name and form the upper- and lowercase letters both in and out of order and demonstrate knowledge of alphabetic order, with automaticity

35057736DE574150845177F93FAB80FB.description: use understanding of the sound structure of spoken words to orally isolate, blend, and segment phonemes, from simple structures with two phonemes to structures with more phonemes

F1F08A8A3B974FCEB189EA9DF5D80BE7.description: Language Foundations for Reading and Writing: demonstrate an understanding of foundational language knowledge and skills, and apply this understanding when reading and writing

16A84C08ACC844F9B9AF60D64A19737C.description: use appropriate word choice, including new vocabulary, grammar, and cohesive phrases and sentences when speaking and communicating ideas

D373102C15034E10BDDF444F49D0C241.description: identify and use oral and non-verbal communication strategies, including expression, gestures, and body language, to interpret or contribute to the meaning of messages

23193DDE57494C5C9C3ABF7A019AFEB9.description: identify the purpose and audience for speaking in formal and informal contexts, and use appropriate speaking strategies, including taking turns, understanding when to speak, and knowing how much to say, to communicate clearly and coherently

8EEF81502B304166B9932D3F708E3698.description: identify and use listening strategies before, during, and after listening to comprehend information communicated orally and non-verbally

B4E475044B22469FBF6EFF8B63066CFE.description: use effective listening skills, including listening attentively and asking relevant questions, in formal and informal contexts, including conversations and classroom activities

9F11236636D44812A53B388D8195DC27.description: Oral and Non-Verbal Communication: apply listening, speaking, and non-verbal communication skills and strategies to understand and communicate meaning in formal and informal contexts and for various purposes and audiences

6720C8F18D8040F1A36FCA3A21390F42.description: identify themes explored in First Nations, Métis, and Inuit cultures to demonstrate an understanding of the varied identities, perspectives, relationships, legacies, truths, and ways of knowing, being, and doing

939DA29B7F3C41D691E78893A5268C89.description: demonstrate an understanding of the contributions, lived experiences, and perspectives of a diversity of individuals and communities, including those in Canada, by exploring the concepts of identity, self, and sense of belonging in culturally responsive and relevant texts

84F002760DA049E6A1E5AC85792FF9F2.description: apply the knowledge and skills developed in this grade to support learning in various subject areas and identify some ways this learning can be used in everyday life

2DFE488602D84202AD1CD67031DF8455.description: Applications, Connections, and Contributions: apply language and literacy skills in cross-curricular and integrated learning, and demonstrate an understanding of, and make connections to, diverse voices, experiences, perspectives, histories, and contributions, including those of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals, communities, groups, and nations

4CD2DCA574B849CB9C5A6BDF38311176.description: communicate and collaborate with various communities in a safe, respectful, responsible, and inclusive manner when using online platforms and environments, including digital and media tools, and demonstrate cultural awareness with members of the community

861620A3BFCD4FE4A7056F1746F8648C.description: use digital and media tools to support stages of the design process and to develop creative solutions to authentic, real-world problems

5DA14D2B88EB466B8A4797D6077F3F40.description: demonstrate an understanding of the interrelationships between the form, message, and context of a text, the audience, and the creator

A320A15B8C5C4A1DB3537C6148C964B9.description: demonstrate an understanding of the forms, conventions, and techniques of digital and media texts, and apply this understanding when analyzing texts

E6B7C04322734F04ACB058F9CA8FD38A.description: gather, evaluate, and use information, considering various perspectives, to construct knowledge and demonstrate learning

6E0B9003F7E84DBBA2AC4D4828FBD2E1.description: demonstrate an understanding of how to navigate online environments safely, manage their privacy, and interact in a way that supports their well-being and that of others, including seeking appropriate permission

8B8BEE2CE182460DAF0591BDED3D0285.description: demonstrate an understanding of their rights and responsibilities when interacting online with appropriate permission, and make decisions that contribute positively to the development of their digital identity and those of their communities

9735EE72573E471FAFDFF9BE024F89EB.description: Digital Media Literacy: demonstrate and apply the knowledge and skills needed to interact safely and responsibly in online environments, use digital and media tools to construct knowledge, and demonstrate learning as critical consumers and creators of media

1F263DA5FEB44142823A97FF79A720A8.description: demonstrate an understanding of how transferable skills help them to express their voice and be engaged in their learning

9FAA78F44F3049D189BBD4EB07189A23.description: identify how transferable skills can be used to support communication in various cultural, social, linguistic, and domain-specific contexts, and apply them when reading, listening to, viewing, and creating texts of various forms

D5E49C5940C04D159647A3C8033E86C3.description: Transferable Skills: demonstrate an understanding of how the seven transferable skills (critical thinking and problem solving; innovation, creativity, and entrepreneurship; self-directed learning; collaboration; communication; global citizenship and sustainability; and digital literacy) are used in various language and literacy contexts
